image.altText: Stroke victim Michelle Hatt posing for a photo outside South Australian Parliament with her parents.Â

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman has come forward as another victim of South Australia's ramping crisis, claiming she was ramped for two and a half hours while presenting with symptoms of a stroke.

title.children: Adelaide woman with stroke symptoms waited hours in ambulance outside hospital

image.altText: Krystal and Anastasia Marshall hug and smile.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of murdering her ex-wife has been recorded on prison phone calls with her male co-accused discussing their need to "stick to the story" and to "pin it" on him, an Adelaide court has heard.

title.children: Prison calls recorded alleged murderers discussing case and 'where certain witnesses live'

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Former senator Natasha Stott Despoja has been appointed to head South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

title.children: SA's newly announced DV royal commissioner aims to 'eradicate' family, sexual violence

image.altText: A council building.

props.synopsis: A council in South Australia's south-east becomes the third in South Australia to remove an Acknowledgement of Country from its council meeting procedures, disappointing Reconciliation South Australia and local elders.

title.children: Elders 'disheartened' by removal of Acknowledgement of Country from council meetings

image.altText: Two men standing behind the ribcage of a skeleton exhibit in a museum.

props.synopsis: A fossil from the distant past is rewriting the narrative of how, when, and where baleen whalesÂ â such as the blue whaleÂ â became some of the largest animals to have ever lived on the planet.

title.children: Whale fossil in river sheds light on how pre-historic beasts morphed into today's giants of the sea

image.altText: Shane Drumgold out the front of the ACT courts.

props.synopsis: The ACT's former top prosecutor Shane Drumgold has succeeded inÂ challenging some findings made against him in an inquiry into the prosecution of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Former prosecutor succeeds in challenging inquiry findings into Bruce Lehrmann prosecution

image.altText: A split image showing an older man and a younger man.

props.synopsis: A campsite believed to have been being used by the men was discovered in the Murchison region on the weekend.

title.children: Full-scale search for father and son prospectors underway in WA

image.altText: Camellia Aebischer poses on a balcony wearing a large backpack, ready to travel to Asia after taking time off work.

props.synopsis: Last year I was working a dream job, running a successful side hustle with my partner and had a core group of friends. It was also the year I booked the most sessions with a counsellor.

title.children: Why I decided to stop everything and take a gap year at 32

image.altText: a folder with a cervical screening kit next to a pair of gloved hands holding a testing swab, printed in duotone colour

props.synopsis: More than a quarter of patients are choosing the self-testing option.

title.children: DIY cervical cancer screening is on the up. Here's how you do it

image.altText: A woman sits on a park bench

props.synopsis: Professional basketballer Alex Bunton didn't know that what she was experiencing was abuse and struggled to reach out for help. New data shows many who find themselves in similar situations never escape.Â

title.children: Pro basketballer's domestic abuse started with love-bombing and financial control before it turned physical

image.altText: Sliced beetroot in front of a burger with beetroot on it.

props.synopsis: Australia's reliance on imports is being blamed for a national shortage of sliced beetroot that has been frustrating consumers for months.

title.children: Why your 'burger with the lot' hasn't included sliced beetroot for a while

image.altText: A colourful can of rabbit meat destined for London

props.synopsis: Long since vanished from dinner plates, Australia's canned rabbit was once popular fare as far away as London.

title.children: How canned rabbit, once a dinnertime delicacy, was consigned to the burrows of history

image.altText: A middle-aged black woman with long dark hair speaks into a microphone in front of a painting and American flags.

props.synopsis: US Vice-President Kamala Harris demands Palestinian militant group Hamas agree to an immediate six-week ceasefire and urges Israel to do more to boost aid deliveries to Gaza.

title.children: Kamala Harris urges Hamas to agree to ceasefire and pushes Israel on aid to Gaza

image.altText: Two soccer teams play in an outdoor field half-covered with snow

props.synopsis: Australia snatched a 2-1 win over South Korea in their opening group game of the U20 Women's Asian Cup, with no help from about 15cm of snow that covered the field.

title.children: 'How is this okay?' AFC under fire for Young Matildas' snowy U20 Asian Cup pitch

image.altText: large burgundy coloured bus comes to a stop down embankment after collision

props.synopsis: A truck driver who smashed into a back of a school bus in Bacchus March faces dozens of charges over the incident, which expert witnesses say has left students traumatised.

title.children: Students involved in 2022 bus crash still suffer nightmares and flashbacks, Melbourne court hears

image.altText: Mohammad Qazzaz at his coffee roastery with a Palestinian keffiyeh around his shoulders

props.synopsis: Arab American votes were once all but guaranteed for Democrats, but now in the swinging state of Michigan where every vote counts, that once faithful voter bloc is shrinking â and furious.

title.children: This group of voters could decide who next takes the White House â and they're furious

image.altText: Taken through window shutters, a person is arrested on a suburban street by many police officers

props.synopsis: A man dies and a woman is rushed to hospital after police earlier warned residents of a knife wielding man in the Perth suburb of Greenwood.Â

title.children: Elderly man dead, woman in hospital, man under arrest following stabbings in suburban Perth

image.altText: A man being held by a rescue worker lifted on to a boat

props.synopsis: A young man is recovering after being rescued from a rocky ledge in a dramatic operation off Perth's coast on Monday morning.

title.children: Dramatic scenes as man rescued in rough seas from island off Perth coast

image.altText: Min Wo

props.synopsis: One talented child in a family is exceptional. Two is extraordinary. Siblings Minjee and Min Woo Lee are both big stars on the golf circuit â¦ but they couldnât be more different.Â

title.children: The rebel and the rule follower: How Min Woo and Minjee Lee became superstar siblings

image.altText: A composite image of Brisbane Broncos' Ezra Mam and Sydney Roosters' Spencer Leniu during their NRL season opener in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: As the NRL investigates an allegation of a racial slur in the marquee game of the NRL Las Vegas showpiece, Brisbane Broncos coach Kevin Walters says his five-eighth was upset in the rooms after the match and "adamant" Spencer Leniu racially abused him.

title.children: Broncos and Roosters clash in Vegas hotel after allegation of racial abuse in NRL season opener

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: The relief among Labor MPs and officials was palpable,Â but the celebratory speeches at the Liberal Party function did appear incongruous with the stark reality of an election loss, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: The stark reality is Dutton's 'working-class' strategy wasn't a hit with voters

image.altText: A close up of a chicken's head

props.synopsis: More than 3,000 hens have been rehomed after a distressing discovery on a property near Toowoomba. A complaint has been made and authorities are investigating.

title.children: Investigation launched after thousands of chickens left for dead at Queensland egg farm

image.altText: A South Sydney NRL player grimaces as he is holds on to the ball while being tackled.

props.synopsis: Growing concern around concussions in sport has seen the AIS recommending longer periods before athletes return to training and playing post-injury â but we don't yet know how the NRL and AFL, among others, will respond, writes David Mark.

title.children: Football players in limbo amid wait for response to new concussion guidelines

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market closes lower on Monday, down 0.13% to 7,735, after reaching a new record highÂ of 7,769 earlier. See how the day's events unfolded.

title.children: ASX closes lower after reaching new high â as it happened

image.altText: Large shark lying in shallow water at a beach.

props.synopsis: A great white shark has died after washing up at Kingscliff Beach on the NSW far north coast.

title.children: Beachgoers shocked as large great white shark washes ashore

image.altText: A man with skin cancers sits in a chair in Darwin.

props.synopsis: After decades of radiation, melanoma removals and skin grafts, LeighÂ Raaschou says he wishes there had been other options years ago to deal with skin cancers.Â

title.children: Cannabis treatment could offer glint of hope for sufferers of one of Australia's worst cancers

image.altText: Eden Golan singing into a microphone in front of a stage. She's wearing a black jumpsuit with a long skirt

props.synopsis: TheÂ competition's organisers have taken issue with verses appearing to reference the Hamas terrorist attack on Israel on October 7. The song, originally called October Rain, will be renamed Hurricane.

title.children: Israel agrees to change Eurovision song lyrics amid concern words reference Gaza war

image.altText: A few ambulances lined up at the bottom of a ramp at a hosptial.

props.synopsis: The Liberal government faced extensive scrutiny over hospital ramping, and now health spokesperson Guy Barnett believes he can end the problem. But doctors have sounded the alarm straight away.

title.children: Medical professionals say Tasmanian Liberals plan to 'ban' ambulance ramping won't work

image.altText: purple cabbage next to an orange sea urchin roe piece

props.synopsis: Workers from Australia and overseas are happy to helpÂ far south coast sea urchin factories crack the export market for the roe of a marine menace.

title.children: Why this expensive seafood delicacy is proving to be a golden export opportunity

image.altText: A line of land rover perenties parked at the Australian frontline machinery site, all cars are camouflaged

props.synopsis: Defence vehicles designed for the battlefield are being repurposed by the public and used on and off the road.

title.children: Second wind for ex-defence vehicles used by everyday Australians for transport, recreation and sense of history

image.altText: A pig in a cage.

props.synopsis: The owner of a Victorian piggery has accepted responsibility for the breaches after an investigation was sparked by video of slaughter practices inside its facilities.

title.children: Australian Food Group admits animal welfare breaches after activists aired abattoir footage

image.altText: Linda Reynolds looks into the distance

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds receives a settlement and apology from the ACT government over a letter former director of public prosecutions Shane Drumgold penned to theÂ Australian Federal Police after Bruce Lehrmann's trial.

title.children: Linda Reynolds gets $90k payout from ACT government over Bruce Lehrmann prosecutor's comments

image.altText: a man smiles as he poses holding a black and white dog

props.synopsis: The sentencing of David McBride next week will be a clarifying moment for whistleblowing protections in this country, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: The US pays its whistleblowers instead of sending them to prison. Should Australia do the same?

image.altText: A smashed car at the bottom of a steep set of stairs

props.synopsis: The driver, believed to be in his 70s, was conscious when ambulance paramedics arrived and he was treated at the scene.

title.children: 'It's a miracle he's alive': CCTV captures moment car plunges down 10-metre wall in Sydney

image.altText: Sally Fitzgibbons waves an Australian flag

props.synopsis: Sally Fitzgibbons becomes the first athlete to win four individual titles at the World Surfing Games, but Australia missed out on securing an extra spot at the Paris Olympics by the barest of margins.

title.children: Fitzgibbons suffers Olympic heartbreak despite winning fourth World Surfing Games gold
